article:
A 'very long chain fatty acid' (VLCFA) is a fatty acid with aliphatic tails
longer than 22 carbons.

Unlike most fatty acids, VLCFAs are too long to be metabolized in the
mitochondria, and must be metabolized in peroxisomes.

Certain peroxisomal disorders, such as adrenoleukodystrophy, can be associated
with an accumulation of VLCFAs.
